intro: Haemaria otletae, commonly known as the Otlet's haworthia, is a rare and small succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically bluish-green with white or purple markings. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
